messages.message: any idea how long the threshold is for confidence scores? This doc is only 6 pages and it says that it's too long for confidence
this is happening across documents with even just 1 page
so it's also sometimes the case that the model doesn't produce confidence for short documents—we're working on revising the text here to be more general
one case is when we're extracting a table for example
flagging this on a 1-page doc. Understand this may stem from something else, just adding more context
when this gets launched, it will be critical that we can give our clients confidence in the answers on documents of any length^
okay yeah, maybe this message is just confusing—possibly it's showing up even when the cause of not having confidence isn't length
this is from the “complex prompt” toggle. we don’t have complex confidence score until later
in which case we should have a different failed tooltip?

cc: @Bastiane on confidence score

@Andrew Sherrill and @ChrisM would we rather not release this feature at all if confidence score is not available for longer docs?
This is just me talking from the limited conversations ive had - I don't see a situation where we can sell our way out of not having confidence scores that they can rely on @ChrisM what do you think?

Yeah, this will be difficult. Without any confidence scores, we're providing data that is perceived to be accurate (because we returned it) but it may not be. But, having unreliable confidence scores could create a scenario where we're flagging everything and casting doubt on the solution actually performing well (or creating false positives that aren't reviewed because they are believed to be correct).

@Bastiane @Eric Han If we don't have confidence scores, what are the remaining validations we can provide?
we’re working on udf validations for 23.45.
